artefact.overview: If you have Huntington's disease you must tell DVLA - download the correct form to let them know
artefact.body:
You must tell DVLA if you have Huntington’s disease.

You can be fined up to £1,000 if you don’t tell DVLA about a medical condition that affects your driving. If you’re involved in an accident, you may be prosecuted.

Car, motorcycle, bus, coach or lorry licence

You must tell DVLA. Fill in form CN1 and send it to DVLA. The address is on the form.

Download ‘CN1 - Confidential medical information’ (PDF, 248KB)
